results.title: Yanis and his dream
results.creator_credit: Ami Amitai and Amitai Film Productions
results.brief_description: The story of a twelve-year-old boy living on the Greek island of Corfu in a small farming village, and his desire to leave the land and become a man of the sea.

results.title: Platinum
results.brief_description: Presents the history of platinum; examines its chemical properties such as stability and catalysis; and shows how it is processed. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Picasso: a painter's diary
results.creator_credit: Perry Miller Adato, Thirteen and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: Presents an overview of the life of Pablo Picasso, the main theme being that Picasso’s painting were his autobiography. Features photographs, documentary footage and interviews with friends and family of Picasso. Many of Picasso’s works are highlighted. Contains some B&W scenes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Narritjin at Djarrakpi. Part 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Narritjin Maymuru (A)”.
Narritjin Maymuru and his family are establishing a small settlement at Djarrakpi, an important Manggalili clan site on the northern head of Blue Mud Bay in the Northern Territory. Narritjin is a renowned artist and he and his family produce bark paintings and craft work to sell at Yirrkala. This program, together with Part 2 [507335], gives an insight into Narritjin’s family life and, through his paintings, his role as an educator, teaching his sons about their clan land and its ancestral history.

results.title: Narritjin at Djarrakpi. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Narritjin Maymuru (A)”.
This program continues the life of Narritjin and his family at his clan settlement at Djarrakpi. Throughout Narritjin tells of his feelings about Djarrakpi and of his hopes for the future. A continuation of the study of the life of Narritjin and his family at his clan settlement at Djarrakpi, where they live largely off the land and the sea, producing bark paintings and craftwork to sell at Yirrkala. Gives an insight into Narritjin’s family life and his role as an educator to his sons.

results.title: Dear diary
results.creator_credit: David Shepard, Debra Franco and Copperfield Films
results.brief_description: Companion film to “Am I normal?” Raising issues and answering questions relating to female puberty, in a humorous and entertaining manner. Provides information on body changes, maturation, peer pressure and self-image. TEACHER PREVIEW RECOMMENDED.

results.title: Time, lines and events. - [Revised]
results.brief_description:
After explaining the use and making of timelines, the film brings on an imaginary Time Machine Camera which can travel down a vertical timeline into the deep past. On command, the camera shows how the earth looked at any particular time. It searches for the beginnings of life, the presence of dinosaurs, for cave people, and the pyramids. The film dramatises the relative briefness of the history of the United States, and of human beings, and concludes by showing how all the events of history give us our sense of time itself.
Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Olympia: the film of the XI Olympic Games. Part II
results.brief_description: Part two from Leni Riefenstahl’s “Olympia”, a record of the Berlin Games of 1936 and an elegy on the youth of 1936, dedicated to the highest ideals of sportsmanship. In this part, Riefenstahl focusses on the aesthetics of the young virile body of the athletes creating a visual poetry in motion.

results.title: Olympia. [Part I]
results.brief_description: Part one from Leni Riefenstahl’s “Olympia”, a record of the Berlin Games of 1936 and an elegy on the youth of 1936, dedicated to the highest ideals of sportsmanship. Riefenstahl picked a crew of 100 cameramen who shot over a million feet of film which she worked on for 18 months, selecting shots for their beauty rather than for a documentary record. The film focuses essentially on the main stadium track and field events with emphasis on the brute physical competitiveness between the athletes. For Part two of this film see Title Code 507315.
